intro: Zeuxine androcardium, commonly known as the broadleaf zeuxine, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes buttercups and other showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of large, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
